acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 2 from 96-hour LC50=1.2mg/L of Crustacea (Mysid shrimp), and others (CICAD18, 1999).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: It was classified as outside of Category since rabbit LD50s were >10 and 10.6g/kg (CICAD 18 (1999), EU-RAR (2001)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Rat LC50 = 8000ppm (39.3mg/L) (ACGIH (2001)) is more than saturated vapor pressure pressures concentrations (4215ppm), and it was judged to be an examination in mist. It was set as the outside of Category based on the guidance value of mist.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Examination concentration of 3577ppm for 6hr on rat (4hr equivalent: 4381ppm) (ACGIH (2001)) corresponds to Category 4. But it presupposed that it cannot be classified since death is not observed. Moreover, examination concentration of 20mg/L for 4hr on rats (EU-RAR (2001)) corresponds to Category 4. But it presupposed that it cannot be classified since death is not observed.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: It was classified into Category 5 based on 2210 mg/kg which was done the statistical culculation of rat LD50 (1400, 4000, 1400, 2910, 2700, 3980, and 4750 mg/kg ((CERI Hazard Data ((1999)), ACGIH ((2001)), EU-RAR ((2001)), and PATTY ((5th, 2001))).

aspiration_hazard.hazard_statement: May be fatal if swallowed and enters airways
aspiration_hazard.rationale: It is a hydrocarbon and dynamic viscosity is not over 20.5mm [2/s ]. And, there was a description "when the fluid is swallowed, there is a risk of chemical pneumonia by aspiration" (ICSC(ICSC(J), (2000))). Moreover, it is classified as R65 in EU. Therefore, we classified it into Category 1.

carcinogenicity.rationale: Since the classifications of EPA were "D and CBD", they classified out of Category.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 2, since acute toxicity was Category 2 and not rapidly degrading (BOD: 33% (existing chemical safety inspections data)), though supposed less bio-accumulative (log Kow=3.66(PHYSPROP Database, 2005)).

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

flammable_liquids.rationale: It was classified as Category 3 based on flash point: 31 degC and UN No.1918 Class: 3 Packing group III.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the two negative results (ACGIH (2001), CICAD 18 (1999), DFGOT vol.13 (1999), EU-RAR (2001)) of the in vivo mouse micronucleus examination, we classified it as Out Of Category. In addition, all in vitro examinations were also negative and the results support the classification as "Out Of Category."

organic_peroxides.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with peroxide present in the molecule.

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing no oxygen, fluorine and chlorine.

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: No developmental toxicity to a neonatal in rat and rabbit examinations is obvious (ACGIH (2001), CICAD 18 (1999), DFGOT vol.13 (1999), EU-RAR (2001), IRIS (2005)). However, since there is no data about the reproductive function and reproductive potential by the exposure in premating, it is considered as it cannot be classified.

respiratory_sensitizer.rationale: Since there was no data, it was decided that It could not be classified.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: By two Draize examinations, mild irritation (ACGIH (2001), EU-RAR (2001)), and others, from middle to severe edemas and erythema of the conjunctiva are reported by individual reports (DFGOT vol.13 (1999)).  Except these one, slight irritation or stimulativeness altogether (ACGIH (2001), CICAD 18 (1999), DFGOT vol.13 (1999), EU-RAR (2001)). Moreover, there is a report that it recovers within five days (ACGIH (2001), CICAD 18 (1999)). Furthermore, it is not classified into "eye irritation" according to the EU classification. It classified into Category 2B from these things.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: As for rabbits, some show moderate stimulativeness (DFGOT vol.13 (1999)). But most show mild irritation (ACGIH (2001), EU-RAR (2001), and CICAD 18 (1999)), and it was not classified as "skin irritative" in EU. So it was classified as Category 3.

skin_sensitizer.rationale: Based on the two reports (ACGIH (2001) and CICAD 18 (1999)) that no skin sensitization was identified in the  maximization test, it .was put outside of the Category.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (central nervous system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Since the effect to central nervous systems in humans was reported (PATTY (5th, 2001)), it was classified to Category 1 (central nervous systems).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification:
Category 1 (central nervous system),
Category 2 (liver, kidney, blood),
Category 3 (narcotic effects, respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement:
Causes damage to organs (central nervous system)
May cause damage to organs (liver, kidney, blood)
May cause respiratory irritation (narcotic effects, respiratory tract irritation)
May cause drowsiness or dizziness (narcotic effects, respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Many influences of a central nervous systems are reported (ACGIH (2001), CICAD (J)18 (1999), EU-RAR (2001), DFGOT vol.13 (1999)), and it was set as Category 1 (central nervous system) from dosage and a guidance value. Moreover, the affect on liver and the kidney (EU-RAR (2001)) and the affect on leukocyte (DFGO vol.13 (1999)) are reported. It was set as category 2 (liver, kidney, blood) from dosage and a guidance value. Furthermore, an anesthetic action (ACGIH (2001), DFGOT vol.13 (1999), EU-RAR (2001)) and respiratory irritation (ACGIH (2001), DFGOT vol.13 (1999)) are reported. It was set as Category 3 (anesthetic action, respiratory irritation).
